subject: Personal Finance
title: Monopolies and Competition
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Monopolies and Competition.

hook.text: Google handles 92% of global searches. When one company dominates, competition ceases to exist.

buildup.text: A monopoly is when a single seller controls a market. Without competition, they can set any price.

discovery.text: Competition forces companies to improve and lower prices. Monopolies have no such pressure.

twist.text: Tech monopolies are tricky. Their products are often free, making traditional antitrust analysis awkward.

climax.text: Antitrust laws exist to prevent monopolies. But enforcement has weakened as industries have consolidated.

punchline.text: No competition means no reason to be good.

quiz.question: Why are monopolies harmful to consumers?
options: Without competition, there's no pressure to improve or lower prices
